mdRecord.dcterms:description: The Ministry Shop served as a workspace for the Elders and Eldresses, who were under the same obligation to perform hand-labor as the brethren and sisters under their care. By 1921 the Ministryâ€™s Shop had become a home for Shaker sisters who had been relocated from the Enfield, Connecticut community after its closure in 1917. -- https://hancockshakervillage.org/shakers/museum/historic-architecture/ministry-shop/ [work]
